page.title: 07The Legend of St. Marwenne.
page.content: Marwenne came to Marhamchurch in the 6th century to bring the word of God to the villagers.She had great healing powers and healed most of the sick and brought peace to the village.She arrived at the village in a rowing boat having been pulled up river by the tide to Hele Bridge. She walked up the hill to the village and built a hut where the war memorial now stands.After a while the villagers built a wooden church for her. Now every year the legend of St.Marwenne is celebrated.The children of the school vote for a queen.She is not always the best looking but the one that is most like Marwenne.She has 6 attendants and a marshaland page.The queen is crowned, rides around the village on a white horse and every-one will celebrate.
